words.translation: Indeed|successful|(are) the believers

translations.1: Qad aflahal mu'minoon
translations.15: Successful indeed are the believers

words.translation: Those who|[they]|during|their prayers|(are) humbly submissive

translations.1: Allazeena hum fee Salaatihim khaashi'oon
translations.15: those who humble themselves in prayer

words.translation: Those who|[they]|from|the vain talk|turn away

translations.1: Wallazeena hum 'anil laghwi mu'ridoon
translations.15: those who avoid idle talk

words.translation: Those who|[they]|of purification works|(are) doers

translations.1: Wallazeena hum liz-Zakaati faa'iloon
translations.15: those who pay alms-tax

words.translation: And those who|[they]|of their modesty|(are) guardians

translations.1: Wallazeena hum lifuroo-jihim haafizoon
translations.15: those who guard their chastity

words.translation: Except|from|their spouses|or|what|possess|their right hands|then indeed, they|(are) not|blameworthy

translations.1: Illaa 'alaaa azwaajihim aw maa malakat aimaanuhum fa-innahum ghairu maloomeen
translations.15: except with their wives or those ˹bondwomen˺ in their possession, for then they are free from blame

words.translation: Then whoever|seeks|beyond|that|then those|[they]|(are) the transgressors

translations.1: Famanib taghaa waraaa'a zaalika fa-ulaaa'ika humul 'aadoon
translations.15: but whoever seeks beyond that are the transgressors

words.translation: And those who|[they]|of their trusts|and their promise(s)|(are) observers

translations.1: Wallazeena hum li-amaanaatihim Wa-'ahdihim raa'oon
translations.15: ˹the believers are also˺ those who are true to their trusts and covenants

words.translation: And those who|[they]|over|their prayers|they guard

translations.1: Wallazeena hum 'alaa Salawaatihim yuhaafizoon
translations.15: and those who are ˹properly˺ observant of their prayers

words.translation: Those|[they]|(are) the inheritors

translations.1: Ulaaa'ika humul waarisoon
translations.15: These are the ones who will be awarded

words.translation: Who|will inherit|the Paradise|They|therein|(will) abide forever

translations.1: Allazeena yarisoonal Firdawsa hum feehaa khaalidoon
translations.15: Paradise as their own. They will be there forever

words.translation: And indeed|We created|the humankind|from|an essence|of|clay

translations.1: Wa-laqad khalaqnal insaana min sulaalatim min teen
translations.15: And indeed, We created humankind from an extract of clay

words.translation: Then|We placed him|(as) a semen-drop|in|a resting place|firm

translations.1: Summa ja'alnaahu nutfatan fee qaraarim makeen
translations.15: then placed each ˹human˺ as a sperm-drop in a secure place

words.translation: Then|We created|the semen-drop|(into) a clinging substance|then We created|the clinging substance|(into) an embryonic lump|then We created|the embryonic lump|(into) bones|then We clothed|the bones|(with) flesh|then|We produce it|(as) a creation|another|So blessed is|Allah|(the) Best|(of) the Creators

translations.1: Summa khalaqnan nutfata 'alaqatan fakhalaqnal 'alaqata mudghatan fakhalaq-nal mudghata 'izaaman fakasawnal 'izaama lahman summa anshaanaahu khalqan aakhar; fatabaarakal laahu ahsanul khaaliqeen
translations.15: then We developed the drop into a clinging clot ˹of blood˺, then developed the clot into a lump ˹of flesh˺, then developed the lump into bones, then clothed the bones with flesh, then We brought it into being as a new creation. So Blessed is Allah, the Best of Creators

words.translation: Then|indeed you|after|that|surely (will) die

translations.1: Summa innakum ba'da zaalika la-maaiyitoon
translations.15: After that you will surely die

words.translation: Then|indeed you|(on the) Day|(of) the Resurrection|will be resurrected

translations.1: Summa innakum Yawmal Qiyaamati tub'asoon
translations.15: then on the Day of Judgment you will be resurrected

words.translation: And indeed|We (have) created|above you|seven|paths|and not|We are|of|the creation|unaware

translations.1: Wa-laqad khalaqnaa fawqakum sab'a taraaa'iqa Wa-maa kunnaa 'anil khalqi ghaafileen
translations.15: And indeed, We created above you seven levels ˹of heaven˺. We are never unmindful of ˹Our˺ creation

words.translation: And We send down|from|the sky|water|in (due) measure|then We cause it to settle|in|the earth|And indeed, We|on|taking it away|taking it away|surely (are) Able

translations.1: Wa-anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'am biqadarin fa-askannaahu fil ardi Wa-innaa 'alaa zahaabim bihee laqaa-diroon
translations.15: We send down rain from the sky in perfect measure, causing it to soak into the earth. And We are surely able to take it away

words.translation: Then We produced|for you|by it|gardens|of date-palms|of date-palms|and grapevines|for you|in it|(are) fruits|abundant|and from them|you eat

translations.1: Fa-anshaanaa lakum bihee Jannaatim min nakheelinw Wa-a'naab; lakum feehaa fawaakihu kaseeratunw Wa-minhaa taakuloon
translations.15: With it We produce for you gardens of palm trees and grapevines, in which there are abundant fruits, and from which you may eat

words.translation: And a tree|(that) springs forth|from|Mount Sinai|Mount Sinai|(which) produces|oil|and a relish|for those who eat

translations.1: Wa-shajaratan takhruju min Toori Sainaaa'a tambutu bidduhni Wa-sibghil lil-aakileen
translations.15: as well as ˹olive˺ trees which grow at Mount Sinai, providing oil and a condiment to eat

words.translation: And indeed|for you|in|the cattle|surely (is) a lesson|We give you drink|from what|(is) in|their bellies|and for you|in them|(are) benefits|many|and of them|you eat

translations.1: Wa-inna lakum fil an'aami la'ibrah; nusqeekum mimmaa fee butoonihaa Wa-lakum feehaa manaafi'u kaseeratunw Wa-minhaa taakuloon
translations.15: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle, from whose bellies We give you ˹milk˺ to drink, and in them are many other benefits for you, and from them you may eat

words.translation: And on them|and on|[the] ships|you are carried

translations.1: Wa-'alaihaa wa'alal fulki tuhmaloon
translations.15: And you are carried upon ˹some of˺ them and upon ships

words.translation: And verily|We sent|Nuh|to|his people|and he said|O my people!|Worship|Allah|not|for you|(is) any|god|other than Him|Then will not|you fear

translations.1: Wa-laqad arsalnaa Noohan ilaa qawmihee faqaala yaa qawmi'budul laaha maa lakum min ilahin ghairuhoo afalaa tattaqoon
translations.15: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people. He declared, “O my people! Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

words.translation: But said|the chiefs|(of) those who|disbelieved|among|his people|This is not|This is not|but|a man|like you|he wishes|to|assert (his) superiority|over you|and if|Allah had willed|Allah had willed|surely He (would have) sent down|Angels|Not|we heard|of this|from|our forefathers|our forefathers

translations.1: Faqaalal mala'ul lazeena kafaroo min qawmihee maa haazaaa illaa basharum mislukum yureedu aien yatafaddala 'alaikum Wa-law shaaa'al laahu la-anzala malaaa'ikatam maa sami'naa bihaazaa feee aabaaa'inal awwaleen
translations.15: But the disbelieving chiefs of his people said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you, who wants to be superior to you. Had Allah willed, He could have easily sent down angels ˹instead˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers

words.translation: Not|he|(is) but|a man|in him|(is) madness|so wait|concerning him|until|a time

translations.1: In huwa illaa rajulum bihee jinnatun fatarabbasoo bihee hattan heen
translations.15: He is simply insane, so bear with him for a while.”

words.translation: He said|My Lord!|Help me|because|they deny me

translations.1: Qaala Rabbin surnee bimaa kazzaboon
translations.15: Noah prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”

words.translation: So We inspired|to him|That|construct|the ship|under Our eyes|and Our inspiration|then when|comes|Our Command|and gushes forth|the oven|then put|into it|of|every (kind)|(of) mates|two|and your family|except|those|(has) preceded|against whom|the Word|thereof|And (do) not|address Me|concerning|those who|wronged|indeed they|(are) the ones to be drowned

translations.1: Fa-awhainaaa ilaihi anis na'il fulka bi-a'yuninaa Wa-wahyinaa fa-izaa jaaa'a amrunaa Wa-faarat tannooru fasluk feehaa min kullin zawjainis naini Wa-ahlaka illaa man sabaqa 'alaihil qawlu minhum Wa-laa tukhaat-ibnee fil lazeena zalamooo innaahum mughraqoon
translations.15: So We inspired him: “Build the Ark under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes and directions. Then when Our command comes and the oven bursts ˹with water˺, take on board a pair from every species along with your family—except those against whom the decree ˹to drown˺ has already been passed. And do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong, for they will surely be drowned.”

words.translation: And when|you (have) boarded|you|and whoever|(is) with you|[on]|the ship|then say|Praise|(be) to Allah|Who|(has) saved us|from|the people|the wrongdoers."

translations.1: Fa-izas tawaita ata Wa-mam ma'aka 'alal fulki faqulil hamdu lillaahil lazee najjaanaa minal qawmiz zalimeen
translations.15: Then when you and those with you have settled in the Ark, say, “All praise is for Allah, Who saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

words.translation: And say|My Lord|cause me to land|(at) a landing place|blessed|and You|(are) the Best|(of) those who cause to"

translations.1: Wa-qur Rabbi anzilnee munzalam mubaarakanw Wa-Anta khairul munzileen
translations.15: And pray, “My Lord! Allow me a blessed landing, for You are the best accommodator.”

words.translation: Indeed|in|that|surely (are) Signs|and indeed|We are|surely testing

translations.1: Inna fee zaalika la-Aayaatinw Wa-in kunnaa lamubtaleen
translations.15: Surely in this are lessons. And We ˹always˺ put ˹people˺ to the test

words.translation: Then|We produced|after them|after them|a generation|another

translations.1: Summaa anshaana mim ba'dihim qarnan aakhareen
translations.15: Then We raised another generation after them

words.translation: And We sent|among them|a Messenger|from themselves|[that]|Worship|Allah|not|for you|(is) any|god|other than Him|Then will not|you fear

translations.1: Fa-arsalnaa feehim Rasoolam minhum ani 'budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo afalaa tattaqoon
translations.15: and sent to them a messenger from among themselves, ˹declaring,˺ “Worship Allah ˹alone˺. You have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

words.translation: And said|the chiefs|of|his people|who|disbelieved|and denied|(the) meeting|(of) the Hereafter|while We had given them luxury|in|the life|(of) the world|Not|(is) this|but|a man|like you|He eats|of what|you eat|[from it]|and he drinks|of what|you drink

translations.1: Wa-qaalal mala-u min qawmihil lazeena kafaroo Wa-kazzaboo bi-liqaaa'il Aakhirati Wa-atrafnaahum fil hayaatid dunyaa maa haazaaa illaa basharum mislukum yaakulu mimmaa taakuloona minhu Wa-yashrabu mimmaa tashraboon
translations.15: But the chiefs of his people—who disbelieved, denied the meeting ˹with Allah˺ in the Hereafter, and were spoiled by the worldly luxuries We had provided for them—said ˹to the masses˺, “This is only a human like you. He eats what you eat, and drinks what you drink

words.translation: And surely if|you obey|a man|like you|indeed you|then|surely (will be) losers

translations.1: Wa-la'in at'atum basharam mislakum innakum izal lakhaasiroon
translations.15: And if you ˹ever˺ obey a human like yourselves, then you would certainly be losers

words.translation: Does he promise you|that you|when|you are dead|and you become|dust|and bones|that you|(will be) brought forth

translations.1: A-Ya'idukum annakum izaa mittum Wa-kuntum turaabanw Wa-izaaman annakum mukhrajoon
translations.15: Does he promise you that once you are dead and reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth ˹alive˺

words.translation: Far-(fetched)|far-(fetched)|is what|you are promised!

translations.1: Haihaata haihaata limaa too'adoon
translations.15: Impossible, simply impossible is what you are promised

words.translation: Not|it|(is) but|our life|(of) the world|we die|and we live|and not|we|(will be) resurrected

translations.1: In hiya illaa hayaatunad dunyaa namootu Wa-nahyaa Wa-maa nahnu bimab'ooseen
translations.15: There is nothing beyond our worldly life. We die, others are born, and none will be resurrected

words.translation: Not|(is) he|but|a man|who (has) invented|about|Allah|a lie|and not|we|(in) him|(are) believers

translations.1: In huwa illaa rajulunif taraa 'alal laahi kazibanw Wa-maa nahnuu lahoo bimu'mineen
translations.15: He is no more than a man who has fabricated a lie about Allah, and we will never believe in him.”

words.translation: He said|My Lord!|Help me|because|they deny me

translations.1: Qaala Rabbin surnee bimaa kazzaboon
translations.15: The messenger prayed, “My Lord! Help me, because they have denied ˹me˺.”

words.translation: He said|After a little while|After a little while|surely they will become|regretful

translations.1: Qaala 'ammaa qaleelil la-yusbihunna naadimeen
translations.15: Allah responded, “Soon they will be truly regretful.”

words.translation: So seized them|the awful cry|in truth|and We made them|(as) rubbish of dead leaves|So away|with the people|the wrongdoers

translations.1: Fa-akhazat-humus saihatu bilhaqqi faja'alnaahum ghusaaa'aa; fabu;dal lilqaw-miz zaalimeen
translations.15: Then the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook them with justice, and We reduced them to rubble. So away with the wrongdoing people

words.translation: Then|We produced|after them|after them|a generation|another

translations.1: Summa anshaanaa mim ba'dihim quroonan aakhareen
translations.15: Then We raised other generations after them

words.translation: Not|can precede|any|nation|its term|and not|they (can) delay (it)

translations.1: Maa tasbiqu min ummatin ajalahaa Wa-maa yastaakhiroon
translations.15: No people can advance their doom, nor can they delay it

words.translation: Then|We sent|Our Messengers|(in) succession|Every time|Every time|came|(to) a nation|its Messenger|they denied him|so We made (them) follow|some of them|others|and We made them|narrations|So away|with a people|not|they believe

translations.1: Summa arsalnaa Rusulanaa tatraa kulla maa jaaa'a ummatar Rasooluhaa kazzabooh; fa-atba'naa ba'dahum ba'danw Wa-ja'alnaahum ahaadees; fabu'dal liqawmil laa yu'minoon
translations.15: Then We sent Our messengers in succession: whenever a messenger came to his people, they denied him. So We destroyed them, one after the other, reducing them to ˹cautionary˺ tales. So away with the people who refuse to believe

words.translation: Then|We sent|Musa|and his brother|Harun|with Our Signs|and an authority|clear

translations.1: Summa arsalnaa Moosaa Wa-akhaahu Haaroona bi-Aayaatinaa Wa-sultaanim mubeen
translations.15: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and compelling proof

words.translation: To|Firaun|and his chiefs|but they behaved arrogantly|and they were|a people|haughty

translations.1: Ilaa Fir'awna Wa-mala'ihee fastakbaroo Wa-kaanoo qawman 'aaleen
translations.15: to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a tyrannical people

words.translation: Then they said|Shall we believe|(in) two men|like ourselves|while their people|for us|(are) slaves

translations.1: Faqaaloo annu'minu libasharaini mislinaa Wa-qawmuhumaa lanaa 'aabidoon
translations.15: They argued, “Will we believe in two humans, like ourselves, whose people are slaves to us?”

words.translation: So they denied them|and they became|of|those who were destroyed

translations.1: Fakazzaboohumaa fakaanoo minal muhlakeen
translations.15: So they rejected them both, and ˹so˺ were among those destroyed

words.translation: And verily|We gave|Musa|the Scripture|so that they may|be guided

translations.1: Wa-laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba la'allahum yahtadoon
translations.15: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so perhaps his people would be ˹rightly˺ guided

words.translation: And We made|(the) son|(of) Maryam|and his mother|a Sign|and We sheltered them|to|a high ground|of tranquility|of tranquility|and water springs

translations.1: Wa-ja'alnab na Maryama Wa-ummahooo aayatannw Wa-aawainaahumaaa ilaa rabwatin zaati qaraarinw Wa-ma'een
translations.15: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them refuge on high ground—a ˹suitable˺ place for rest with flowing water

words.translation: O Messengers|O Messengers|Eat|of|the good things|and do|righteous (deeds)|Indeed, I Am|of what|you do|All-Knower

translations.1: Yaaa-aiyuhar Rusulu kuloo minat taiyibaati wa'maloo saalihan innee bimaa ta'maloona 'Aleem
translations.15: O messengers! Eat from what is good and lawful, and act righteously. Indeed, I fully know what you do

words.translation: And indeed|this|your religion|(is) religion|one|And I Am|your Lord|so fear Me

translations.1: Wa-inna haaziheee ummatukum ummatanw waahidatanw Wa-Ana Rabbukum fattaqoon
translations.15: Surely this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so fear Me ˹alone˺

words.translation: But they cut off|their affair (of unity)|between them|(into) sects|each|faction|in what|they have|rejoicing

translations.1: Fataqatta'ooo amrahum bainahum zuburaa; kullu hizbim bimaa ladaihim farihoon
translations.15: Yet the people have divided it into different sects, each rejoicing in what they have

words.translation: So leave them|in|their confusion|until|a time

translations.1: Fazarhum fee ghamratihim hattaa heen
translations.15: So leave them ˹O Prophet˺ in their heedlessness for a while

words.translation: Do they think|that what|We extend to them|[with it]|of|wealth|and children

translations.1: A-yahsaboona annnamaa numiduhum bihee mim maalinw Wa-baneen
translations.15: Do they think, since We provide them with wealth and children

words.translation: We hasten|to them|in|the good|Nay|not|they perceive

translations.1: Nusaari'u lahum fil khairaat; bal laa yash'uroon
translations.15: that We hasten to ˹honour˺ them ˹with˺ all kinds of good? No! They are not aware

words.translation: Indeed|those who|[they]|from|(the) fear|(of) their Lord|(are) cautious

translations.1: Innal lazeena hum min khashyati Rabbihim mushfiqoon
translations.15: Surely those who tremble in awe of their Lord

words.translation: And those|[they]|in (the) Signs|(of) their Lord|believe

translations.1: Wallazeena hum bi-Aayaati Rabbihim yu'minoon
translations.15: and who believe in the revelations of their Lord

words.translation: And those|[they]|with their Lord|(do) not|associate partners

translations.1: Wallazeena hum bi-Rabbihim laa yushrikoon
translations.15: and who associate none with their Lord

words.translation: And those who|give|what|they give|while their hearts|(are) fearful|because they|to|their Lord|(will) return

translations.1: Wallazeena yu'toona maaa aataw Wa-quloobuhum wajilatun annahum ilaa Rabbihim raaji'oon
translations.15: and who do whatever ˹good˺ they do with their hearts fearful, ˹knowing˺ that they will return to their Lord—

words.translation: (It is) those|who hasten|in|the good (deeds)|and they|in them|(are) foremost

translations.1: Ulaaa'ika yusaari'oona fil khairaati Wa-hum lahaa saabiqoon
translations.15: it is they who race to do good deeds, always taking the lead

words.translation: And not|We burden|any soul|except|(to) its capacity|and with Us|(is) a Record|(which) speaks|with the truth|and they|(will) not|be wronged

translations.1: Wa-laa nukallifu nafsan illaa wus'ahaa Wa-ladainaa kitaabuny yantiqu bilhaqqi Wa-ahum la yuzlamoon
translations.15: We never require of any soul more than what it can afford. And with Us is a record which speaks the truth. None will be wronged

words.translation: Nay|their hearts|(are) in|confusion|over|this|and for them|(are) deeds|besides|besides|that|they|for it|(are) doers

translations.1: Bal quloobuhum fee ghamratim min haazaa Wa-lahum a'maalum min dooni zaalika hum lahaa 'aamiloon
translations.15: But the hearts of those ˹who disbelieve˺ are oblivious to ˹all of˺ this, and they have other ˹evil˺ deeds, opposite to this, in which they are engrossed

words.translation: Until|when|We seize|their affluent ones|with the punishment|behold!|They|cry for help

translations.1: Hattaaa izaaa akhaznaa mutrafeehim bil'azaabi izaa hum yaj'aroon
translations.15: But as soon as We seize their elite with torment, they start to cry for help

words.translation: (Do) not|cry for help|today|Indeed you|from Us|not|will be helped

translations.1: Laa taj'arul yawma innakum minnaa laa tunsaroon
translations.15: ˹They will be told,˺ “Do not cry for help today. Surely you will never be saved from Us

words.translation: Verily|were|My Verses|recited|to you|but you used|(to) on|your heels|turn back

translations.1: Qad kaanat Aayaatee tutlaa 'alaikum fakuntum 'alaaa a'qaabikum tankisoon
translations.15: Indeed, My revelations were recited to you, but you used to back away ˹in disgust˺

words.translation: (Being) arrogant|about it|conversing by night|speaking evil

translations.1: Mustakbireena bihee saamiran tahjuroon
translations.15: boasting of the Sacred House, and babbling ˹nonsense about the Quran˺ by night.”

words.translation: Then, do not|they ponder|the Word|or|has come to them|what|not|(had) come|(to) their forefathers|(to) their forefathers

translations.1: Afalam yaddabbarrul qawla am jaaa'ahum maa lam yaati aabaaa'ahumul awwaleen
translations.15: Is it because they have never contemplated the Word ˹of Allah˺? Or ˹because˺ there has come to them something that did not come to their forefathers

words.translation: Or|(do) not|they recognize|their Messenger|so they|(are) rejecting him|(are) rejecting him

translations.1: Am lam ya'rifoo Rasoolahum fahum lahoo munkiroon
translations.15: Or ˹because˺ they failed to recognize their Messenger, and so they denied him

words.translation: Or|they say|In him|(is) madness|Nay|he brought them|the truth|but most of them|to the truth|(are) averse

translations.1: Am yaqooloona bihee jinnnah; bal jaaa'ahum bilhaqqi Wa-aksaruhum lil-haqqi kaarihoon
translations.15: Or ˹because˺ they say, “He is insane?” In fact, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them are resentful of the truth

words.translation: But if|(had) followed|the truth|their desires|surely (would) have been corrupted|the heavens|and the earth|and whoever|(is) therein|Nay|We have brought them|their reminder|but they|from|their reminder|(are) turning away

translations.1: Wa-lawit taba'al haqqu ahwaaa'ahum lafasadatis samaawaatu wal-ardu Wa-man feehinnn; bal atainaahum bizikrihim fahum 'an zikrihim mu'ridoon
translations.15: Had the truth followed their desires, the heavens, the earth, and all those in them would have certainly been corrupted. In fact, We have brought them ˹the means to˺ their glory, but they turn away from it

words.translation: Or|you ask them|(for) a payment|But the payment|(of) your Lord|(is) best|and He|(is) the Best|(of) the Providers

translations.1: Am tas'aluhum kharjan fakharaaju Rabbika khairunw Wa-Huwa khairur raaziqeen
translations.15: Or ˹is it because˺ you ˹O Prophet˺ are asking them for tribute? But the reward of your Lord is best, for He is the Best Provider

words.translation: And indeed you|certainly call them|to|(the) Path|Straight

translations.1: Wa-innaka latad'oohum ilaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
translations.15: And surely you are calling them to the Straight Path

words.translation: And indeed|those who|(do) not|believe|in the Hereafter|from|the path|surely (are) deviating

translations.1: Wa-innnal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil-Aakhirati 'anis siraati lanaakiboon
translations.15: but those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are certainly deviating from that Path

words.translation: And if|We had mercy on them|and We removed|what|(was) on them|of|(the) hardship|surely they would persist|in|their transgression|wandering blindly

translations.1: Wa-law rahimnaahum Wa-kashafnaa maa bihim min durril lalajjoo fee tughyaanihim ya'mahoon
translations.15: ˹Even˺ if We had mercy on them and removed their affliction, they would still persist in their transgression, wandering blindly

words.translation: And verily|We seized them|with the punishment|but not|they submit|to their Lord|and not|they supplicate humbly

translations.1: Wa-laqad akhaznaahum bil'azaabi famas takaanoo li-Rabbihim Wa-maa yatadarra'oon
translations.15: And We have already seized them with torment, but they never humbled themselves to their Lord, nor did they ˹submissively˺ appeal ˹to Him˺

words.translation: Until|when|We opened|for them|a gate|of a punishment|of a punishment|severe|behold|They|in it|(will be in) despair

translations.1: Hattaaa izaa fatahnaa 'alaihim baaban zaa 'azaabin shadeedin izaa hum feehi mublisoon
translations.15: But as soon as We open for them a gate of severe punishment, they will be utterly desperate

words.translation: And He|(is) the One Who|produced|for you|the hearing|and the sight|and the feeling|little|(is) what|you give thanks

translations.1: Wa-Huwal lazeee ansha-a lakumus sam'a wal-absaara wal-af'idah; qaleelam maa tashkuroon
translations.15: He is the One Who created for you hearing, sight, and intellect. ˹Yet˺ you hardly give any thanks

words.translation: And He|(is) the One Who|multiplied you|in|the earth|and to Him|you will be gathered

translations.1: Wa-Huwal lazee zara-akum fil ardi Wa-ilaihi tuhsharoon
translations.15: And He is the One Who has dispersed you ˹all˺ over the earth, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be gathered

words.translation: And He|(is) the One Who|gives life|and causes death|and for Him|(is the) alternation|(of) the night|and the day|Then will not|you reason

translations.1: Wa-Huwal lazee yuhyee Wa-yumeetu Wa-lahukh tilaaful laili wannahaar; afalaa ta'qiloon
translations.15: And He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of the day and night. Will you not then understand

words.translation: Nay|they say|(the) like|(of) what|said|the former (people)

translations.1: Bal qaaloo misla maa qaalal awwaloon
translations.15: But they ˹just˺ say what their predecessors said

words.translation: They said|What! When|we are dead|and become|dust|and bones|would we|surely be resurrected

translations.1: Qaalooo 'a-izaa mitnaa Wa-kunnaa turaabanw Wa-'izaaman 'a-innaa lamab-'oosoon
translations.15: They said, “Once we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be resurrected

words.translation: Verily|we have been promised|[we]|and our forefathers|this|before|before|not|(is) this|but|(the) tales|(of) the former (people)

translations.1: Laqad wu'idnaa nahnu Wa-aabaaa'unaa haazaa min qablu in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen
translations.15: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!”

words.translation: Say|To whom (belongs)|the earth|and whoever|(is) in it|if|you|know

translations.1: Qul limanil ardu Wa-man feehaaa in kuntum ta'lamoon
translations.15: Ask ˹them, O Prophet˺, “To whom belong the earth and all those on it, if you ˹really˺ know?”

words.translation: They will say|To Allah|Say|Then will not|you remember

translations.1: Sa-yaqooloona lillaah; qul afalaa tazakkkaroon
translations.15: They will reply, “To Allah!” Say, “Why are you not then mindful?”

words.translation: Say|Who|(is the) Lord|(of) the seven heavens|(of) the seven heavens|and (the) Lord|(of) the Throne|the Great

translations.1: Qul mar Rabbus samaawaatis sab'i Wa-Rabbul 'Arshil 'Azeem
translations.15: ˹And˺ ask ˹them˺, “Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?”

words.translation: They will say|Allah|Say|Then will not|you fear (Him)

translations.1: Sa-yaqooloona lillaah; qul afalaa tattaqoon
translations.15: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “Will you not then fear ˹Him˺?”

words.translation: Say|Who is (it)|in Whose Hand(s)|(is the) dominion|(of) all|things|and He|protects|and no (one)|(can) be protected|against Him|If|you|know

translations.1: Qul mam bi-yadihee malakootu kulli shai'inw Wa-Huwa yujeeru Wa-laa yujaaru 'alaihi in kuntum ta'lamoon
translations.15: Ask ˹them also,˺ “In Whose Hands is the authority over all things, protecting ˹all˺ while none can protect against Him, if you ˹really˺ know?”

words.translation: They will say|Allah|Say|Then how|are you deluded

translations.1: Sa-yaqooloona lillaah; qul fa-annaa tus-haroon
translations.15: They will reply, “Allah.” Say, “How are you then so deluded?”

words.translation: Nay|We (have) brought them|the truth|but indeed they|surely (are) liars

translations.1: Bal atainaahum bil-haqqi Wa-innahum lakaaziboon
translations.15: In fact, We have brought them the truth, and they are certainly liars

words.translation: Not|Allah has taken|Allah has taken|any|son|and not|is|with Him|any|god|Then|surely (would have) taken away|each|god|what|he created|and surely would have overpowered|some of them|[on]|others|Glory be|(to) Allah|above what|they attribute

translations.1: Mat takhazal laahu minw waladinw Wa-maa kaana ma'ahoo min ilaah; izal lazahaba kullu ilaahim bimaa khalaqa Wa-la'alaa ba'duhum 'alaa ba'd; Subhaannal laahi 'ammaa yasifoon
translations.15: Allah has never had ˹any˺ offspring, nor is there any god besides Him. Otherwise, each god would have taken away what he created, and they would have tried to dominate one another. Glorified is Allah above what they claim

words.translation: Knower|(of) the unseen|and the witnessed|exalted is He|above what|they associate

translations.1: Aalimil Ghaibi wash-shahhaadati fata'aalaa 'ammaa yushrikoon
translations.15: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and unseen. Exalted is He above what they associate ˹with Him˺

words.translation: Say|My Lord!|If|You should show me|what|they are promised

translations.1: Qur Rabbi immmaa turiyannee maa yoo'adoon
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Should You show me what they are threatened with

words.translation: My Lord|then (do) not|place me|among|the people|the wrongdoers

translations.1: Rabbi falaa taj'alnee fil qawmiz zaalimeen
translations.15: then, my Lord, do not count me among the wrongdoing people.”

words.translation: And indeed We|on|that|We show you|what|We have promised them|surely able

translations.1: Wa-innaa 'alaaa an nuriyaka maa na'iduhum laqaadiroon
translations.15: We are indeed able to show you what We have threatened them with

words.translation: Repel|by that|which|(is) best|the evil|We|know best|of what|they attribute

translations.1: Idfa' billate hiya ahsanus saiyi'ah; nahnu a'lamu bimaa yasifoon
translations.15: Respond to evil with what is best. We know well what they claim

words.translation: And say|My Lord!|I seek refuge|in You|from|(the) suggestions|(of) the evil ones

translations.1: Wa-qur Rabbi a'oozu bika min hamazaatish Shayaateen
translations.15: And say, “My Lord! I seek refuge in You from the temptations of the devils

words.translation: And I seek refuge|in You|My Lord!|Lest|they be present with me

translations.1: Wa-a'oozu bika Rabbi aien yahduroon
translations.15: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, that they ˹even˺ come near me.”

words.translation: Until|when|comes|(to) one of them|the death|he says|My Lord!|Send me back

translations.1: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'a ahada-humul mawtu qaala Rabbir ji'oon
translations.15: When death approaches any of them, they cry, “My Lord! Let me go back

words.translation: That I may|do|righteous (deeds)|in what|I left behind|No|Indeed, it|(is) a word|he|speaks it|and before them|and before them|(is) a barrier|till|(the) Day|they are resurrected

translations.1: La'alleee a'malu saalihan feemaa taraktu kallaa; innahaa kalimatun huwa qaaa'iluhaa Wa-minw waraaa'ihim barzakhun ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon
translations.15: so I may do good in what I left behind.” Never! It is only a ˹useless˺ appeal they make. And there is a barrier behind them until the Day they are resurrected

words.translation: So when|is blown|in|the trumpet|then not|(there) will be relationship|among them|that Day|and not|will they ask each other

translations.1: Fa-izaa nufikha fis Soori falaaa ansaaba bainahum yawma'izinw Wa-laa yatasaaa'aloon
translations.15: Then, when the Trumpet will be blown, there will be no kinship between them on that Day, nor will they ˹even care to˺ ask about one another

words.translation: Then (the one) whose|(are) heavy|his scales|then those|they|(are) the successful

translations.1: Faman saqulat mawaazee-nuhoo fa-ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon
translations.15: As for those whose scale is heavy ˹with good deeds˺, it is they who will be successful

words.translation: But (the one) whose|(are) light|his scales|then those|they [who]|have lost|their souls|in|Hell|they (will) abide forever

translations.1: Wa-man khaffat mawaa-zeenuhoo fa-ulaaa'ikal lazeena khasiroo 'anfusahum fee Jahannama khaalidoon
translations.15: But those whose scale is light, they will have doomed themselves, staying in Hell forever

words.translation: Will burn|their faces|the Fire|and they|in it|(will) grin with displaced lips

translations.1: Talfahu wujoohahumun Naaru Wa-hum feehaa kaalihoon
translations.15: The Fire will burn their faces, leaving them deformed

words.translation: Were not|Were not|My Verses|recited|to you|and you used (to)|deny them|deny them

translations.1: Alam takun Aayaatee tutlaa 'alaikum fakuntum bihaa tukazziboon
translations.15: ˹It will be said,˺ “Were My revelations not recited to you, but you used to deny them?”

words.translation: They (will) say|Our Lord!|Overcame|[on] us|our wretchedness|and we were|a people|astray

translations.1: Qaaloo Rabbanaa ghalabat 'alainaa shiqwatunaa Wa-kunnaa qawman daaalleen
translations.15: They will cry, “Our Lord! Our ill-fate took hold of us, so we became a misguided people

words.translation: Our Lord!|Bring us out|from it|then if|we return|then indeed we|(would be) wrongdoers

translations.1: Rabbanaa akhrijnaa minhaa fa-in 'udnaa fa-innaa zaalimoon
translations.15: Our Lord! Take us out of this ˹Fire˺. Then if we ever return ˹to denial˺, we will truly be wrongdoers.”

words.translation: He (will) say|Remain despised|in it|and (do) not|speak to Me

translations.1: Qaalakh sa'oo feehaa Wa-laa tukallimoon
translations.15: Allah will respond, “Be despised in there! Do not ˹ever˺ plead with Me ˹again˺

words.translation: Indeed|(there) was|a party|of|My slaves|(who) said|Our Lord!|We believe|so forgive|us|and have mercy on us|and You|(are) best|(of) those who show mercy

translations.1: Innahoo kaana fareequm min 'ibaadee yaqooloona Rabbanaaa aamannaa faghfir lanaa warhamnaa Wa-Anta khairur raahimeen
translations.15: Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to pray, ‘Our Lord! We have believed, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of those who show mercy,’

words.translation: But you took them|(in) mockery|until|they made you forget|My remembrance|and you used (to)|at them|laugh

translations.1: Fattakhaztumoohum sikhriyyan hattaaa ansawkum zikree Wa-kuntum minhum tadhakoon
translations.15: but you were ˹so busy˺ making fun of them that it made you forget My remembrance. And you used to laugh at them

words.translation: Indeed I|have rewarded them|this Day|because|they were patient|indeed they|[they]|(are) the successful ones

translations.1: Inee jazaituhumul Yawma bimaa sabarooo annahum humul faaa'izoon
translations.15: Today I have indeed rewarded them for their perseverance: they are certainly the triumphant.”

words.translation: He will say|How long|did you remain|in|the earth|(in) number|(of) years

translations.1: Qaala kam labistum fil ardi 'adada sineen
translations.15: He will ask ˹them˺, “How many years did you remain on earth?”

words.translation: They will say|We remained|a day|or|a part|(of) a day|but ask|those who keep count

translations.1: Qaaloo labisnaa yawman aw ba'da yawmin fas'alil 'aaaddeen
translations.15: They will reply, “We remained ˹only˺ a day or part of a day. But ask those who kept count.”

words.translation: He will say|Not|you stayed|but|a little|if|only you|[you]|knew

translations.1: Qaala il labistum illaa qaleelal law annakum kuntum ta'lamoon
translations.15: He will say, “You only remained for a little while, if only you knew

words.translation: Then did you think|that|We created you|uselessly|and that you|to Us|not|will be returned

translations.1: Afahsibtum annamaa khalaqnaakum 'abasanw Wa-annakum ilainaa laa turja'oon
translations.15: Did you then think that We had created you without purpose, and that you would never be returned to Us?”

words.translation: So exalted is|Allah|the King|the Truth|(There is) no|god|except|Him|(the) Lord|(of) the Throne|Honorable

translations.1: Fata'aalal laahul Malikul Haqq; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa Rabbul 'Arshil Kareem
translations.15: Exalted is Allah, the True King! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Honourable Throne

words.translation: And whoever|invokes|with|Allah|god|other|no|proof|for him|in it|Then only|his account|(is) with|his Lord|Indeed [he]|not|will succeed|the disbelievers

translations.1: Wa-maien yad'u ma'allaahi ilaahan aakhara laa burhaana lahoo bihee fa-inna maa hisaabuhoo 'inda Rabbih; innahoo laa yuflihul kaafiroon
translations.15: Whoever invokes, besides Allah, another god—for which they can have no proof—they will surely find their penalty with their Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will never succeed

words.translation: And say|My Lord!|Forgive|and have mercy|and You|(are the) Best|(of) those who show mercy

translations.1: Wa-qul Rabbigh fir warham Wa-Anta khairur raahimeen
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord! Forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of those who show mercy.”
